attributes.review: to understand my frustrations with this app we must first begin when i was a young child. i grew up with the usual family set up: my mom was a penguin and my dad was a seagull. making me, a pengull. i had the happiest of childhoods until i finally realized something insane. i could fly. now i know what you all must be thinking â€œarenâ€™t you part penguin? penguins donâ€™t fly silly goose!â€ and to that i say â€œ iâ€™m not a goose!!!â€ anyways my first time flying was incredible!! i absolutely loved every second of it. i felt free and happy and content with my life. it seemed as if the world was finally making sense to me. now you might be wondering, â€œwhat is this stupid bird talking about and why is it related to this app?â€ and to that i respond â€œiâ€™m not stupid!!â€ but alsoâ€iâ€™m getting thereâ€. one day i stumbled across a beautiful ostrich named Comic Sans. she was beautiful, it truly was love at first sight. i cherished every waking moment i had with her. i loved her so deeply and so profoundly that i canâ€™t imagine loving another being as much as i loved her. but alas, my age span (though widely debated) is roughly immortal. an ostrichâ€™s isnâ€™t. i knew that one day i was going to part with my beautiful Comic Sans. and that day came out on the day this app was released. not only did i think this was an app for trumpets to cheer me up after the passing of loved one, but it also brought back my hatred for ill designed app construction. thereâ€™s nothing i hate more than a glitchy app. there are so many bugs even i wouldnâ€™t eat them. anyways. i hope that nobody downloads this app for the same reasons as myself. it wonâ€™t help you and i stead will leave you with gastrointestinal problems and projectile diarrhea.
